jurisdiction.title: National Coalition for Core Arts Standards

1BA1BCDC9A124431B29EF6E0565C5B82.description: Appraise the impact of an artist or a group of artists on the beliefs, values, and behaviors of a society.

EEABE4A7D3194E6D82EE5A1E7044AE5B.description: Compare uses of art in a variety of societal, cultural, and historical contexts and make connections to uses of art in contemporary and local contexts.

A3EB898DDF67426E810C866A9B68A15C.description: Describe how knowledge of culture, traditions, and history may influence personal responses to art.

D024488BF33F4012A48B0436C59147A8.description: Distinguish different ways art is used to represent, establish, reinforce, and reflect group identity.

4484C7F888B847019910061EA8F5355E.description: Analyze how response to art is influenced by understanding the time and place in which it was created, the available resources, and cultural uses.

233709EC4780464088357924729F91B1.description: Analyze how art reflects changing times, traditions, resources, and cultural uses.

A4D704E287DF4C5FBB36D2C8048D0209.description: Identify how art is used to inform or change beliefs, values, or behaviors of an individual or society.

A5B5ADAFADD44A66BFE823E3425DCD5D.description: Through observation, infer information about time, place, and culture in which a work of art was created.

4C32428A817949F8A07C601FA88A0E72.description: Recognize that responses to art change depending on knowledge of the time and place in which it was made.

C6A4A989C4424EB1BE65B8D69F1255DC.description: Compare and contrast cultural uses of artwork from different times and places.

A5BBE42F20C241F8B235CAAD8CEFE088.description: Understand that people from different places and times have made art for a variety of reasons.

F276FEE78BA44B8C865B8EDD18D6AEEB.description: Identify a purpose of an artwork.

ACEA39ADE96A47D19B189225CCCE9AA8.description: Enduring Understanding: People develop ideas and understandings of society, culture, and history through their interactions with and analysis of art.

A0BE872BD74348F6927269F32D074D5F.description: Anchor Standard 11: Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to deepen understanding

3342C5B3445F4876B6203413E6CBDA11.description: Synthesize knowledge of social, cultural, historical, and personal life with art-making approaches to create meaningful works of art or design.

12701C7DBD5645F9BC260D2AA4FD8E45.description: Utilize inquiry methods of observation, research, and experimentation to explore unfamiliar subjects through art- making.

6E557E83E9C84C71BDF2EF46D61BE6A9.description: Document the process of developing ideas from early stages to fully elaborated ideas.

A63F1DFEDD064AED9B6556517B8C5883.description:
Make art
collaboratively to reflect on and reinforce positive aspects of group identity.

9900598134C948BA956D9D2FF5E220D0.description:
Individually or
collaboratively
create visual documentation of places and times in which people gather to make and experience art or design in the community.

2E77C029809A498C9A2C97B1DA258522.description: Generate a collection of ideas reflecting current interests and concerns that could be investigated in art- making.

F94789FB0862413680F5D269D6BF51DE.description: Apply formal and conceptual vocabularies of art and design to view surroundings in new ways through art- making.

24B7C1309079489892D1800035E26C83.description: Create works of art that reflect community cultural traditions.

102BC868B4A148E8890470BC0990D409.description: Develop a work of art based on observations of surroundings.

3C0D6114AC2847479D0B87C679847A9B.description: Create works of art about events in home, school, or community life.

AF7D66A73A8B41119490F9697250E7D7.description: Identify times, places, and reasons by which students make art outside of school.

D03250CA50994802B5B5DF21C9BB497E.description: Create art that tells a story about a life experience.

95BA7437DB7F4CCCA4279DAEBFFDCEC1.description: Enduring Understanding: Through art-making, people make meaning by investigating and developing awareness of perceptions, knowledge, and experiences.

2344536E598843CCBE0A246E4A8C7D4E.description: Anchor Standard 10: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.

E0D4853E3780420EBB39578E60C9122C.description: Construct evaluations of a work of art or collection of works based on differing sets of criteria.

5C10D1791D684343A5A4B9F901753516.description: Determine the relevance of criteria used by others to evaluate a work of art or collection of works.

C8492DCA00BD4FC0874F746EA805CD65.description: Establish relevant criteria in order to evaluate a work of art or collection of works.

692ABA8D26A74EEFB20744C4AB9821A5.description: Create a convincing and logical argument to support an evaluation of art.

CE131AC224F541A7B8CCB8DF077B8A32.description: Compare and explain the difference between an evaluation of an artwork based on personal criteria and an evaluation of an artwork based on a set of established criteria.

4F17E9964A2746F48B0CA2D526A273FD.description:
Develop and apply
relevant criteria to evaluate a work of art.

7B568A8775594FA4A133C90B1D704685.description: Recognize differences in criteria used to evaluate works of art depending on styles, genres, and media as well as historical and cultural contexts.

C270CC34840F4814BA71C8A12B41AEF3.description:
Apply one set of
criteria to evaluate more than one work of art

24F174C55B694D07B15C92A04BDDA728.description: Evaluate an artwork based on given criteria.

83F379531F0E4919BAF56CD2BC4CBF3D.description: Use learned art vocabulary to express preferences about artwork.

43488FE8F68B4FE4BF2D2375A1F0C8E8.description: Classify artwork based on different reasons for preferences.

BCD40BBA1A994200927B0851614750C2.description: Explain reasons for selecting a preferred artwork.

C88D78DDF5464D929D39B35F343FDBB5.description: Enduring Understanding: People evaluate art based on various criteria.

87287A8EA6664777A514F37E14CFF760.description: Anchor Standard 9: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

41B333A22AFB48B7A24E73FDC26EF756.description: Analyze differing interpretations of an artwork or collection of works in order to select and defend a plausible critical analysis.

6419CAC79C2748DEADA44FEA425A08AA.description: Identify types of contextual information useful in the process of constructing interpretations of an artwork or collection of works.

717FE8CA0A1C4A01AEF553AE5271A156.description: Interpret an artwork or collection of works, supported by relevant and sufficient evidence found in the work and its various contexts.

FD26C287E5104F4F8C87E48E26919A43.description: Interpret art by analyzing how the interaction of subject matter, characteristics of form and structure, use of media, art- making approaches, and relevant contextual information contributes to understanding messages or ideas and mood conveyed.

532B25D0A3ED47AAB8CC0045748705E6.description: Interpret art by analyzing art- making approaches, the characteristics of form and structure, relevant contextual information, subject matter, and use of media to identify ideas and mood conveyed.

20CD12ADB2B6401E84520BCD955DCD7B.description: Interpret art by distinguishing between relevant and non-relevant contextual information and analyzing subject matter, characteristics of form and structure, and use of media to identify ideas and mood conveyed.

7DEDAA31FC234390A180FB0031A70032.description: Interpret art by analyzing characteristics of form and structure, contextual information, subject matter, visual elements, and use of media to identify ideas and mood conveyed

762474B85FAF41E2B2C570A3F133885C.description: Interpret art by referring to contextual information and analyzing relevant subject matter, characteristics of form, and use of media.

A76EA2B320F54A108420A4D03E3C5262.description: Interpret art by analyzing use of media to create subject matter, characteristics of form, and mood.

1C86FC90C0C341288E11E5EAD1D72363.description: Interpret art by identifying the mood suggested by a work of art and describing relevant subject matter and characteristics of form.

00A8F189961B42E0BB5EBAFDFDEB2A7D.description: Interpret art by categorizing subject matter and identifying the characteristics of form.

17C2CF07684C4D8E8FC9E46A50D35734.description: Interpret art by identifying subject matter and describing relevant details.

B4767E6167EE4E55A6DBEB860A4A6C34.description: Enduring Understanding: People gain insights into meanings of artworks by engaging in the process of art criticism.

8CC309E851E14B90B3E4D5FC2E7C0FC5.description: Anchor Standard 8: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

2312EE42A9A4470EB6D2F7C5F1D423E9.description:
Determine the
commonalities
within a group of
artists or visual
images attributed to
a particular type of
art, timeframe, or
culture.

4BF68451CC604C0DB91E32C927CBBFB8.description:
Evaluate the
effectiveness of an
image or images to
influence ideas,
feelings, and
behaviors of specific
audiences.

CEB6A9167EBE4A4CBF7D506A3430D402.description:
Analyze how one’s
understanding of
the world is
affected by
experiencing visual
imagery.

7F1470F6C952462CB097B117AB17AE85.description:
Compare and
contrast contexts
and media in which
viewers encounter
images that
influence ideas,
emotions, and
actions.

89EEC5BFFA29465A96F9F9829E22518F.description:
Analyze multiple
ways that images
influence specific
audiences.

55DD36FE50CB466A93DF35676D79C02E.description:
Analyze ways that
visual components
and cultural
associations
suggested by
images influence
ideas, emotions,
and actions.

49D57EF3FEB54D3F9513A757B2908BAB.description:
Identify and analyze
cultural associations
suggested by visual
imagery.

C0E78E31049743B89CD2D78586367812.description:
Analyze
components in
visual imagery that
convey messages.

E7EA3003751245EABA6E990AC17F1064.description:
Determine
messages
communicated by
an image.

822745A54D6D4B54B013C1198706F143.description:
Categorize images
based on expressive
properties.

4DC6E3D09C0F469F9DA29573DE401671.description:
Compare images
that represent the
same subject.

7BC5816D42F14825809EB32FA3B547D9.description: Enduring Understanding: Visual imagery influences understanding of and responses to the world.

AB898D39F98A45F3AD8CDC52693FE50C.description: Analyze how responses to art develop over time based on knowledge of and experience with art and life.

F2C8FEC1109B4CCF8C004072298C6721.description: Recognize and describe personal aesthetic and empathetic responses to the natural world and constructed environments.

6B6D6E1FF9064D259E824585230B5055.description: Hypothesize ways in which art influences perception and understanding of human experiences.

0DEA3989BC044A2181F1E90C6CC2DC2E.description: Explain how a person’s aesthetic choices are influenced by culture and environment and impact the visual image that one conveys to others.

EF48A0779F104845946AD93D81371473.description: Explain how the method of display, the location, and the experience of an artwork influence how it is perceived and valued.

7BA59CFD3B3E4AE28E30733F57312C33.description: Identify and interpret works of art or design that reveal how people live around the world and what they value.

EE59E13E902C418FAD2DC841B18AE11E.description: Compare one's own interpretation of a work of art with the interpretation of others.

2734C518325B40808E0D4BC9388DB683.description: Compare responses to a work of art before and after working in similar media.

3A96AAE958DF4A01BB71B3E21ADF93F8.description: Speculate about processes an artist uses to create a work of art.

2B779DE62DDC428EB8D5C757A5FCB0F5.description: Perceive and describe aesthetic characteristics of one’s natural world and constructed environments.

ED5238D98EA04ABCA0C5A2A2513DB9B4.description: Select and describe works of art that illustrate daily life experiences of one’s self and others.

E0321AC04D6F4922BE60DB8FD80C005B.description: Identify uses of art within one’s personal environment.

40766BD5C0064D99864D70A1500989CC.description: Enduring Understanding: Individual aesthetic and empathetic awareness developed through engagement with art can lead to understanding and appreciation of self, others, the natural world, and constructed environments

02320515A7174353BA0A54F428DEF556.description: Anchor Standard 7: Perceive and analyze artistic work

4F73DE8D75AE464DAC375228C157CF7E.description: Curate a collection of objects, artifacts, or artwork to impact the viewer’s understanding of social, cultural, and/or political experiences.

238B891E9CE64A478FD73FF62508BB32.description: Make, explain, and justify connections between artists or artwork and social, cultural, and political history.

C96901A4F0E4401B905B2F466D7D1552.description: Analyze and describe the impact that an exhibition or collection has on personal awareness of social, cultural, or political beliefs and understandings.

CD6149B802624AA2BB82907CCAD12997.description: Analyze why and how an exhibition or collection may influence ideas, beliefs, and experiences.

DC0972D42E644B4798BC60D1E092B05D.description: Compare and contrast viewing and experiencing collections and exhibitions in different venues.

75A124943E6F4A768B7DF2D75BDECD97.description: Assess, explain, and provide evidence of how museums or other venues reflect history and values of a community.

B3E815B183274153AFED614D72722F9D.description: Cite evidence about how an exhibition in a museum or other venue presents ideas and provides information about a specific concept or topic.

8102905C6B994FD8B65E399ECBA678E6.description: Compare and contrast purposes of art museums, art galleries, and other venues, as well as the types of personal experiences they provide.

EB38226F206F481C9AF6FEBC0DF88349.description: Identify and explain how and where different cultures record and illustrate stories and history of life through art.

2F102B8F5BFF429CBC702AC23F9E80BB.description: Analyze how art exhibited inside and outside of schools (such as in museums, galleries, virtual spaces, and other venues) contributes to communities.

8A503D230A6C47669D3E5EB09C5F51FF.description: Identify the roles and responsibilities of people who work in and visit museums and other art venues.

7D336223B5ED4F4BBC8FF13037566BD5.description: Explain what an art museum is and distinguish how an art museum is different from other buildings.

E597FB0917BB4C049163618873DADD4D.description:
Enduring Understanding: Objects, artifacts, and artworks collected, preserved, or presented either by artists, museums, or other venues communicate meaning and a record of social, cultural, and political experiences resulting in the cultivating of appreciation and
understanding.

737C2C7FECA7419A9BCFB3336474F6A0.description: Anchor Standard 6: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

B79D2C0C3BE044B7A4715E6277CF540A.description: Investigate, compare, and contrast methods for preserving and protecting art.

4F6028284638437BACD6C9FB0411B5E8.description: Evaluate, select, and apply methods or processes appropriate to display artwork in a specific place.

5DDF7B0952A848EA9CDFDBB0D6D4DAB4.description: Analyze and evaluate the reasons and ways an exhibition is presented.

FD76BF0292134129B07243FF23DCE976.description:
Collaboratively
prepare and present selected theme- based artwork for display, and formulate exhibition narratives for the viewer.

51DFECCB3C2B44278B9E481261BEFB41.description: Based on criteria, analyze and evaluate methods for preparing and presenting art.

ADAE6E10C1364A6BAC783E72F0412E9D.description:
Individually or
collaboratively, develop a visual plan for displaying works of art, analyzing exhibit space, the needs of the viewer, and the layout of the exhibit.

6A588E5EE85343709854129700E054AD.description: Develop a logical argument for safe and effective use of materials and techniques for preparing and presenting artwork.

E6E17F9EFC8246A5AAC794580FA38327.description: Analyze the various considerations for presenting and protecting art in various locations, indoor or outdoor settings, in temporary or permanent forms, and in physical or digital formats.

FAC4DFECD4874508B8AB15BE5ABFD776.description: Identify exhibit space and prepare works of art including artists’ statements, for presentation.

18CDEAE2772A4406A54B7CCB574DCB26.description: Distinguish between different materials or artistic techniques for preparing artwork for presentation.

CD5227BE13B94B399C2D7008734505C8.description: Ask and answer questions such as where, when, why, and how artwork should be prepared for presentation or preservation.

3263B5B4E8C64B449646D52C8D80F1A7.description: Explain the purpose of a portfolio or collection.

3EB2161040B34F1BB165C402ECEBB1BF.description: Enduring Understanding: Artists, curators and others consider a variety of factors and methods including evolving technologies when preparing and refining artwork for display and or when deciding if and how to preserve and protect it

1F94F860CED24764875E6CB3AAF6C3AB.description: Anchor Standard 5: Develop and refine artistic techniques and work for presentation.

5995D111CEE749A6BDDEDD296D425275.description: Critique, justify, and present choices in the process of analyzing, selecting, curating, and presenting artwork for a specific exhibit or event.

B910BEF669BC4FD2A34C1360FA8544BA.description:
Analyze, select, and
critique personal artwork for a collection or portfolio presentation.

E3FDC508718344509004A8D60C5B1F6E.description:
Analyze, select, and
curate artifacts and/or artworks for presentation and preservation.

FE88D6AD9B0C431788226D21F3990167.description:
Develop and apply
criteria for evaluating a collection of artwork for presentation.

049DD11421B64AA68190FA7A9DFBEF9A.description: Compare and contrast how technologies have changed the way artwork is preserved, presented, and experienced.

00F751BDB7774FCD90D74AFA200E9AF9.description: Analyze similarities and differences associated with preserving and presenting two- dimensional, three- dimensional, and digital artwork.

2ABB7475DBBB4EB3988BCFA49C0B9B88.description: Define the roles and responsibilities of a curator, explaining the skills and knowledge needed in preserving, maintaining, and presenting objects, artifacts, and artwork.

71EE3535D2454305A903378B1C289202.description: Analyze how past, present, and emerging technologies have impacted the preservation and presentation of artwork.

CB8B729599FD4930A193963D43824D4A.description: Investigate and discuss possibilities and limitations of spaces, including electronic, for exhibiting artwork.

0689BF1A68F94B3C829500D553C929B2.description: Categorize artwork based on a theme or concept for an exhibit.

94F68ED9CDFA4068B313B9EC050F6EE4.description: Explain why some objects, artifacts, and artwork are valued over others.

CAF31E5B05D946D59B4A2344AA693EDB.description: Select art objects for personal portfolio and display, explaining why they were chosen.

2F24D07992CA43058690C51C5403C303.description: Enduring Understanding: Artists and other presenters consider various techniques, methods, venues, and criteria when analyzing, selecting, and curating objects artifacts, and artworks for preservation and presentation.

95E2BA2C00D04DC8AF11DEAEBBF6890F.description: Anchor Standard 4: Select, analyze, and interpret artistic work for presentation.

9F1E823767FB44B79403B8F497C06180.description: Reflect on, re- engage, revise, and refine works of art or design considering relevant traditional and contemporary criteria as well as personal artistic vision.

21EB22282D994BDCBA8EA0D5689ADCE1.description: Engage in constructive critique with peers, then reflect on, re- engage, revise, and refine works of art and design in response to personal artistic vision.

FBEF36CD007949D7AF2575D2455C0344.description: Apply relevant criteria from traditional and contemporary cultural contexts to examine, reflect on, and plan revisions for works of art and design in progress.

FE4D524054954F59B204BB4FB5436CB0.description:
Apply relevant
criteria to examine, reflect on, and plan revisions for a work of art or design in progress.

728E1C333A5343A8A41F5E42AC872B3B.description: Reflect on and explain important information about personal artwork in an artist statement or another format.

C92BC932918342678C3A34E4A0184207.description: Reflect on whether personal artwork conveys the intended meaning and revise accordingly.

660B032B8B824F8492520D865BEBD802.description: Create artist statements using art vocabulary to describe personal choices in art- making.

8DF15D364ABF4F3BBE808C66F601AC7B.description: Revise artwork in progress on the basis of insights gained through peer discussion.

6C02B7AD48EB4E3AB662DC57EAFCDB67.description: Elaborate visual information by adding details in an artwork to enhance emerging meaning.

A83374AF2451435EBC8391D455448E93.description: Discuss and reflect with peers about choices made in creating artwork.

9F124B23B1F94823BA73708C94209744.description: Use art vocabulary to describe choices while creating art.

AC946737443147E58F3CD3DEB3696DDF.description: Explain the process of making art while creating.

52B4D2901E414D45907996CF174AF817.description: Enduring Understanding: Artist and designers develop excellence through practice and constructive critique, reflecting on, revising, and refining work over time.

C68CBA69A04D4B4AA5C2DC279A90A5CE.description: Anchor Standard 3: Refine and complete artistic work.

E4DD9B3C4A9F40919DA4B2433DE00595.description:
Demonstrate in
works of art or
design how visual
and material culture
defines, shapes,
enhances, inhibits,
and/or empowers
people's lives.

7A76A93ECA734189BD5492531FDA7FA5.description:
Redesign an object,
system, place, or
design in response
to contemporary
issues.

1D5B60E9D6B14388A9124965F47A649F.description:
Collaboratively
develop a proposal
for an installation,
artwork, or space
design that
transforms the
perception and
experience of a
particular place.

1BFFD27B98334CDE8AC996557CA5ABD7.description:
Select, organize,
and design images
and words to make
visually clear and
compelling
presentations.

6134FAC9118943C2B6AA259838E568FB.description:
Apply visual
organizational
strategies to design
and produce a work
of art, design, or
media that clearly
communicates
information or
ideas.

6752E34DB2CB429F913182C23158E377.description:
Design or redesign
objects, places, or
systems that meet
the identified needs
of diverse users.

BD6B33BB5E214F819E3AD3FD313DA0E8.description:
Identify, describe,
and visually
document places
and/or objects of
personal
significance.

CF2BC0EAAB8A4430B483ED7F5BC73869.description:
Document,
describe, and
represent regional
constructed
environments.

18D4ECDC04004E9DA709B61C11C3CD1B.description:
Individually or
collaboratively
construct
representations,
diagrams, or maps
of places that are
part of everyday
life.

34337685D20F4B0FA4789D1E354AB86B.description:
Repurpose objects
to make something
new.

3438FDD0AE424C8580A48C27421B2E3A.description:
Identify and classify
uses of everyday
objects through
drawings, diagrams,
sculptures, or other
visual means.

C5B753E15B434EA38D48A1A7C27D717E.description:
Create art that
represents natural
and constructed
environments.

6763651FDC1F406581C91EBDC2C3A08A.description: Enduring Understanding: People create and interact with objects, places, and design that define, shape, enhance, and empower their lives.

EFD84ED7650B45A6B7CCA5D5C04924D7.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of
the importance of
balancing freedom
and responsibility in
the use of images,
materials, tools, and
equipment in the
creation and
circulation of
creative work.

5DD52342A3E0439A94D18F8D4FB21E6B.description:
Demonstrate
awareness of ethical
implications of
making and
distributing creative
work.

CA7CEE499E514A99BF90E9EE8025A3D0.description:
Explain how
traditional and nontraditional
materials
may impact human
health and the
environment and
demonstrate safe
handling of
materials, tools, and
equipment.

19066CED5BDC4431957E5E848AA1F4EF.description:
Demonstrate
awareness of
practices, issues,
and ethics of
appropriation, fair
use, copyright, open
source, and creative
commons as they
apply to creating
works of

1C4BC862AEB74C56BAB7093AB45F54A6.description:
Demonstrate
awareness of ethical
responsibility to
oneself and others
when posting and
sharing images and
other materials
through the
Internet, social
media, and other
communication
formats

0E7B1891CC6A4035A35F656B7A07CF54.description:
Explain
environmental
implications of
conservation, care,
and clean-up of art
materials, tools, and
equipment.

CBC23B5DA4454521BA40FEE4027C51D3.description:
Demonstrate quality
craftsmanship
through care for
and use of
materials, tools, and
equipment.

3A91D85D6F804332A6D58ED18741A220.description:
When making works
of art, utilize and
care for materials,
tools, and
equipment in a
manner that
prevents danger to
oneself and others

1CF33EBE14774A569BB8683DBA7F417F.description:
Demonstrate an
understanding of
the safe and
proficient use of
materials, tools, and
equipment for a
variety of artistic
processes.

B0ED4D9358454ED2857043DD8E059A76.description:
Demonstrate safe
procedures for
using and cleaning
art tools,
equipment, and
studio spaces.

CD4023836ACE4D2CBBF562F09014C21C.description:
Demonstrate safe
and proper
procedures for
using materials,
tools, and
equipment while
making art.

C5CC90EC2D0E408A8D0D449C23713B34.description:
Identify safe and
non-toxic art
materials, tools, and
equipment.

4E34B24017434A9DB431A906715EBE45.description: Enduring Understanding: Artists and designers balance experimentation and safety, freedom and responsibility while developing and creating artworks.

6D06308F41D84C16B2DEBB967E935396.description: Experiment, plan, and make multiple works of art and design that explore a personally meaningful theme, idea, or concept.

ED3784087D544576B7393A385E4B5E19.description: Through experimentation, practice, and persistence, demonstrate acquisition of skills and knowledge in a chosen art form.

9B6E626980214618B96F9293CE8B3C80.description: Engage in making a work of art or design without having a preconceived plan.

79F42B47271242A8AA3870B94890DF34.description: Demonstrate willingness to experiment, innovate, and take risks to pursue ideas, forms, and meanings that emerge in the process of art- making or designing.

F8920344E9FB46ACB9E0575FDC8E6CE2.description: Demonstrate persistence in developing skills with various materials, methods, and approaches in creating works of art or design.
